057/**
058 * Provides different utilities methods to apply processing from a security perspective.<br>
059 * These code snippet:
060 * <ul>
061 *     <li>Can be used, as "foundation", to customize the validation to the app context.</li>
062 *     <li>Were implemented in a way to facilitate adding or removal of validations depending on usage context.</li>
063 *     <li>Were centralized on one class to be able to enhance them across time as well as <a href="https://github.com/righettod/code-snippets-security-utils/issues">missing case/bug identification</a>.</li>
064 * </ul>
065 */
066public class SecurityUtils {
067
068    /**
069     * Default constructor: Not needed as the class only provides static methods.
070     */
071    private SecurityUtils() {
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Apply a collection of validation to verify if a provided PIN code is considered weak (easy to guess) or none.<br>
076     * This method consider that format of the PIN code is [0-9]{6,}<br>
077     * Rule to consider a PIN code as weak:<br>
078     * - Length is inferior to 6 positions.<br>
079     * - Contain only the same number or only a sequence of zero.<br>
080     * - Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers.<br>
081     *
082     * @param pinCode PIN code to verify.
083     * @return True only if the PIN is considered as weak.
084     */
085    public static boolean isWeakPINCode(String pinCode) {
086        boolean isWeak = true;
087        //Length is inferior to 6 positions
088        //Use "Long.parseLong(pinCode)" to cause a NumberFormatException if the PIN is not a numeric one
089        //and to ensure that the PIN is not only a sequence of zero
090        if (pinCode != null && Long.parseLong(pinCode) > 0 && pinCode.trim().length() > 5) {
091            //Contain only the same number
092            String regex = String.format("^[%s]{%s}$", pinCode.charAt(0), pinCode.length());
093            if (!Pattern.matches(regex, pinCode)) {
094                //Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers
095                char previousChar = 'X';
096                boolean containSequence = false;
097                for (char c : pinCode.toCharArray()) {
098                    if (previousChar != 'X') {
099                        int previousNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(previousChar));
100                        int currentNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(c));
101                        if (currentNbr == (previousNbr - 1) || currentNbr == (previousNbr + 1)) {
102                            containSequence = true;
103                            break;
104                        }
105                    }
106                    previousChar = c;
107                }
108                if (!containSequence) {
109                    isWeak = false;
110                }
111            }
112        }
113        return isWeak;
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Apply a collection of validations on a Word 97-2003 (binary format) document file provided:<br>
118     * - Real Microsoft Word 97-2003 document file.<br>
119     * - No VBA Macro.<br>
120     * - No embedded objects.<br>
121     *
122     * @param wordFilePath Filename of the Word document file to check.
123     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
124     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/"
125     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/document/"
126     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/how-to.html"
127     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/embeded.html"
128     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/"
129     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.poi/poi"
130     */
131    public static boolean isWord972003DocumentSafe(String wordFilePath) {
132        boolean isSafe = false;
133        try {
134            File wordFile = new File(wordFilePath);
135            if (wordFile.exists() && wordFile.canRead() && wordFile.isFile()) {
136                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid Word 97-2003 format file
137                try (POIFSFileSystem fs = new POIFSFileSystem(wordFile)) {
138                    //Step 2: Check if the document contains VBA macros, in our case is not allowed
139                    VBAMacroReader macroReader = new VBAMacroReader(fs);
140                    Map<String, String> macros = macroReader.readMacros();
141                    if (macros == null || macros.isEmpty()) {
142                        //Step 3: Check if the document contains any embedded objects, in our case is not allowed
143                        //From POI documentation:
144                        //Word normally stores embedded files in subdirectories of the ObjectPool directory, itself a subdirectory of the filesystem root.
145                        //Typically, these subdirectories and named starting with an underscore, followed by 10 numbers.
146                        final List<String> embeddedObjectFound = new ArrayList<>();
147                        DirectoryEntry root = fs.getRoot();
148                        if (root.getEntryCount() > 0) {
149                            root.iterator().forEachRemaining(entry -> {
150                                if ("ObjectPool".equalsIgnoreCase(entry.getName()) && entry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
151                                    DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectory = (DirectoryEntry) entry;
152                                    if (objPoolDirectory.getEntryCount() > 0) {
153                                        objPoolDirectory.iterator().forEachRemaining(objPoolDirectoryEntry -> {
154                                            if (objPoolDirectoryEntry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
155                                                DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry = (DirectoryEntry) objPoolDirectoryEntry;
156                                                if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.getEntryCount() > 0) {
157                                                    objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.forEach(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry -> {
158                                                        if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.isDocumentEntry()) {
159                                                            embeddedObjectFound.add(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.getName());
160                                                        }
161                                                    });
162                                                }
163                                            }
164                                        });
165                                    }
166                                }
167                            });
168                        }
169                        isSafe = embeddedObjectFound.isEmpty();
170                    }
171                }
172            }
173        } catch (Exception e) {
174            isSafe = false;
175        }
176        return isSafe;
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Ensure that an XML file does not contain any External Entity, DTD or XInclude instructions.
181     *
182     * @param xmlFilePath Filename of the XML file to check.
183     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
184     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/xxe"
185     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html#java"
186     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/13/security/java-api-xml-processing-jaxp-security-guide.html#GUID-82F8C206-F2DF-4204-9544-F96155B1D258"
187     * @see "https://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude-11/"
188     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XInclude"
189     */
190    public static boolean isXMLSafe(String xmlFilePath) {
191        boolean isSafe = false;
192        try {
193            File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
194            if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
195                //Step 1a: Verify that the XML file content does not contain any XInclude instructions
196                boolean containXInclude = Files.readAllLines(xmlFile.toPath()).stream().anyMatch(line -> line.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).contains(":include "));
197                if (!containXInclude) {
198                    //Step 1b: Parse the XML file, if an exception occur than it's imply that the XML specified is not a valid ones
199                    //Create an XML document builder throwing Exception if a DOCTYPE instruction is present
200                    DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
201                    dbfInstance.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);
202                    //Xerces 2 only
203                    //dbfInstance.setFeature("http://xerces.apache.org/xerces2-j/features.html#disallow-doctype-decl",true);
204                    dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
205                    DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
206                    //Parse the document
207                    Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
208                    isSafe = (doc != null && doc.getDocumentElement() != null);
209                }
210            }
211        } catch (Exception e) {
212            isSafe = false;
213        }
214        return isSafe;
215    }
216
217
218    /**
219     * Extract all URL links from a PDF file provided.<br>
220     * This can be used to apply validation on a PDF against contained links.
221     *
222     * @param pdfFilePath pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to process.
223     * @return A List of URL objects that is empty if no links is found.
224     * @throws Exception If any error occurs during the processing of the PDF file.
225     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
226     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
227     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
228     */
229    public static List<URL> extractAllPDFLinks(String pdfFilePath) throws Exception {
230        final List<URL> links = new ArrayList<>();
231        File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
232        try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
233            PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
234            AnnotationFilter actionURIAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
235                @Override
236                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
237                    boolean keep = false;
238                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
239                        keep = (((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction() instanceof PDActionURI);
240                    }
241                    return keep;
242                }
243            };
244            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
245                try {
246                    page.getAnnotations(actionURIAnnotationFilter).forEach(annotation -> {
247                        PDActionURI linkAnnotation = (PDActionURI) ((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction();
248                        try {
249                            URL urlObj = new URL(linkAnnotation.getURI());
250                            if (!links.contains(urlObj)) {
251                                links.add(urlObj);
252                            }
253                        } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
254                            throw new RuntimeException(e);
255                        }
256                    });
257                } catch (Exception e) {
258                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
259                }
260            });
261        }
262        return links;
263    }
264
265    /**
266     * Apply a collection of validations on a PDF file provided:<br>
267     * - Real PDF file<br>
268     * - No attachments.<br>
269     * - No Javascript code.<br>
270     * - No links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData.<br>
271     *
272     * @param pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to check.
273     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
274     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/36161267"
275     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
276     * @see "https://github.com/jonaslejon/malicious-pdf"
277     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
278     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
279     */
280    public static boolean isPDFSafe(String pdfFilePath) {
281        boolean isSafe = false;
282        try {
283            File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
284            if (pdfFile.exists() && pdfFile.canRead() && pdfFile.isFile()) {
285                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid PDF file
286                try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
287                    //Step 2: Check if the file contains attached files, in our case is not allowed
288                    PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
289                    PDDocumentNameDictionary namesDictionary = new PDDocumentNameDictionary(documentCatalog);
290                    if (namesDictionary.getEmbeddedFiles() == null) {
291                        //Step 3: Check if the file contains Javascript code, in our case is not allowed
292                        if (namesDictionary.getJavaScript() == null) {
293                            //Step 4: Check if the file contains links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData, in our case is not allowed
294                            final List<Integer> notAllowedAnnotationCounterList = new ArrayList<>();
295                            AnnotationFilter notAllowedAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
296                                @Override
297                                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
298                                    boolean keep = false;
299                                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
300                                        PDAnnotationLink link = (PDAnnotationLink) annotation;
301                                        PDAction action = link.getAction();
302                                        if ((action instanceof PDActionURI)
303                                                || (action instanceof PDActionLaunch)
304                                                || (action instanceof PDActionRemoteGoTo)
305                                                || (action instanceof PDActionImportData)
306                                        ) {
307                                            keep = true;
308                                        }
309                                    }
310                                    return keep;
311                                }
312                            };
313                            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
314                                try {
315                                    notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.add(page.getAnnotations(notAllowedAnnotationFilter).size());
316                                } catch (IOException e) {
317                                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
318                                }
319                            });
320                            if (notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.stream().reduce(0, Integer::sum) == 0) {
321                                isSafe = true;
322                            }
323                        }
324                    }
325                }
326            }
327        } catch (Exception e) {
328            isSafe = false;
329        }
330        return isSafe;
331    }
332
333    /**
334     * Remove as much as possible metadata from the provided PDF document object.
335     *
336     * @param document PDFBox PDF document object on which metadata must be removed.
337     * @see "https://gist.github.com/righettod/d7e07443c43d393a39de741a0d920069"
338     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
339     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
340     */
341    public static void clearPDFMetadata(PDDocument document) {
342        if (document != null) {
343            PDDocumentInformation infoEmpty = new PDDocumentInformation();
344            document.setDocumentInformation(infoEmpty);
345            PDMetadata newMetadataEmpty = new PDMetadata(document);
346            document.getDocumentCatalog().setMetadata(newMetadataEmpty);
347        }
348    }
349
350
351    /**
352     * Validate that the URL provided is really a relative URL.
353     *
354     * @param targetUrl URL to validate.
355     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
356     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
357     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/q/6785442"
358     */
359    public static boolean isRelativeURL(String targetUrl) {
360        boolean isValid = false;
361        //Reject any URL encoded content and URL starting with a double slash
362        //Reject any URL contains credentials or fragment to prevent potential bypasses
363        String work = targetUrl;
364        if (!work.contains("%") && !work.contains("@") && !work.contains("#") && !work.startsWith("//")) {
365            //Creation of a URL object must fail
366            try {
367                new URL(work);
368                isValid = false;
369            } catch (MalformedURLException mf) {
370                //Last check to be sure (for prod usage compile the pattern one time)
371                isValid = Pattern.compile("^/[a-z0-9]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE).matcher(work).find();
372            }
373        }
374        return isValid;
375    }
376
377    /**
378     * Apply a collection of validations on a ZIP file provided:<br>
379     * - Real ZIP file<br>
380     * - Contain less than a specified level of deepness.<br>
381     * - Do not contain Zip-Slip entry path.<br>
382     *
383     * @param zipFilePath       Filename of the ZIP file to check.
384     * @param maxLevelDeepness  Threshold of deepness above which a ZIP archive will be rejected.
385     * @param rejectArchiveFile Flag to specify if presence of any archive entry will cause the rejection of the ZIP file.
386     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
387     * @see "https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Security%20Hotspot/RSPEC-5042"
388     * @see "https://security.snyk.io/research/zip-slip-vulnerability"
389     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_bomb"
390     * @see "https://github.com/ptoomey3/evilarc"
391     * @see "https://github.com/abdulfatir/ZipBomb"
392     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/cs/zip-bomb"
393     * @see "https://thesecurityvault.com/attacks-with-zip-files-and-mitigations/"
394     * @see "https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/java/IDS04-J.+Safely+extract+files+from+ZipInputStream"
395     */
396    public static boolean isZIPSafe(String zipFilePath, int maxLevelDeepness, boolean rejectArchiveFile) {
397        List<String> archiveExtensions = Arrays.asList("zip", "tar", "7z", "gz", "jar", "phar", "bz2", "tgz");
398        boolean isSafe = false;
399        try {
400            File zipFile = new File(zipFilePath);
401            if (zipFile.exists() && zipFile.canRead() && zipFile.isFile() && maxLevelDeepness > 0) {
402                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid ZIP file
403                try (ZipFile zipArch = new ZipFile(zipFile)) {
404                    //Step 2: Parse entries
405                    long deepness = 0;
406                    ZipEntry zipEntry;
407                    String entryExtension;
408                    String zipEntryName;
409                    boolean validationsFailed = false;
410                    Enumeration<? extends ZipEntry> entries = zipArch.entries();
411                    while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {
412                        zipEntry = entries.nextElement();
413                        zipEntryName = zipEntry.getName();
414                        entryExtension = zipEntryName.substring(zipEntryName.lastIndexOf(".") + 1).toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).trim();
415                        //Step 2a: Check if the current entry is an archive file
416                        if (rejectArchiveFile && archiveExtensions.contains(entryExtension)) {
417                            validationsFailed = true;
418                            break;
419                        }
420                        //Step 2b: Check that level of deepness is inferior to the threshold specified
421                        if (zipEntryName.contains("/")) {
422                            //Determine deepness by inspecting the entry name.
423                            //Indeed, folder will be represented like this: folder/folder/folder/
424                            //So we can count the number of "/" to identify the deepness of the entry
425                            deepness = zipEntryName.chars().filter(ch -> ch == '/').count();
426                            if (deepness > maxLevelDeepness) {
427                                validationsFailed = true;
428                                break;
429                            }
430                        }
431                        //Step 2c: Check if any entries match pattern of zip slip payload
432                        if (zipEntryName.contains("..\\") || zipEntryName.contains("../")) {
433                            validationsFailed = true;
434                            break;
435                        }
436                    }
437                    if (!validationsFailed) {
438                        isSafe = true;
439                    }
440                }
441            }
442        } catch (Exception e) {
443            isSafe = false;
444        }
445        return isSafe;
446    }
447
448    /**
449     * Identify the mime type of the content specified (array of bytes).<br>
450     * Note that it cannot be fully trusted (see the tweet '1595824709186519041' referenced), so, additional validations are required.
451     *
452     * @param content The content as an array of bytes.
453     * @return The mime type in lower case or null if it cannot be identified.
454     * @see "https://twitter.com/righettod/status/1595824709186519041"
455     * @see "https://tika.apache.org/"
456     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.tika/tika-core"
457     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types"
458     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml"
459     */
460    public static String identifyMimeType(byte[] content) {
461        String mimeType = null;
462        if (content != null && content.length > 0) {
463            Detector detector = new DefaultDetector(MimeTypes.getDefaultMimeTypes());
464            Metadata metadata = new Metadata();
465            try {
466                try (TemporaryResources temporaryResources = new TemporaryResources(); TikaInputStream tikaInputStream = TikaInputStream.get(new ByteArrayInputStream(content), temporaryResources, metadata)) {
467                    MediaType mt = detector.detect(tikaInputStream, metadata);
468                    if (mt != null) {
469                        mimeType = mt.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
470                    }
471                }
472            } catch (IOException ioe) {
473                mimeType = null;
474            }
475        }
476        return mimeType;
477    }
478
479    /**
480     * Apply a collection of validations on a string expected to be an public IP address:<br>
481     * - Is a valid IP v4 or v6 address.<br>
482     * - Is public from an Internet perspective.<br><br>
483     * <b>Note:</b> I often see missing such validation in the value read from HTTP request headers like "X-Forwarded-For" or "Forwarded".
484     * <br>
485     * <b>Note for IPv6:</b> I used documentation found so it is really experimental!
486     *
487     * @param ip String expected to be a valid IP address.
488     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
489     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"
490     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/InetAddressValidator.html"
491     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html"
492     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_Orange_Tsai_Talk.pdf"
493     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_SSRF_Bible.pdf"
494     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For"
495     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Forwarded"
496     * @see "https://ipcisco.com/lesson/ipv6-address/"
497     * @see "https://www.juniper.net/documentation/us/en/software/junos/interfaces-security-devices/topics/topic-map/security-interface-ipv4-ipv6-protocol.html"
498     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.base/java/net/InetAddress.html#getByName(java.lang.String)"
499     * @see "https://www.arin.net/reference/research/statistics/address_filters/"
500     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicast_address"
501     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/5619409"
502     * @see "https://www.ripe.net/media/documents/ipv6-address-types.pdf"
503     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments.xhtml"
504     * @see "https://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/Inet6Address"
505     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_local_address"
506     */
507    public static boolean isPublicIPAddress(String ip) {
508        boolean isValid = false;
509        try {
510            //Quick validation on the string itself based on characters used to compose an IP v4/v6 address
511            if (Pattern.matches("[0-9a-fA-F:.]+", ip)) {
512                //If OK then use the dedicated InetAddressValidator from Apache Commons Validator
513                if (InetAddressValidator.getInstance().isValid(ip)) {
514                    //If OK then validate that is an public IP address
515                    //From Javadoc for "InetAddress.getByName": If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
516                    InetAddress addr = InetAddress.getByName(ip);
517                    isValid = (!addr.isAnyLocalAddress() && !addr.isLinkLocalAddress()
518                            && !addr.isLoopbackAddress() && !addr.isMulticastAddress()
519                            && !addr.isSiteLocalAddress());
520                    //If OK and the IP is an V6 one then make additional validation because the built-in Java API will let pass some V6 IP
521                    //For the prefix map, the start of the key indicates if the value is a regex or a string
522                    if (isValid && (addr instanceof Inet6Address)) {
523                        Map<String, String> prefixes = new HashMap<>();
524                        prefixes.put("REGEX_LOOPBACK", "^(0|:)+1$");
525                        prefixes.put("REGEX_UNIQUE-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "^f(c|d)[a-f0-9]{2}:.*$");
526                        prefixes.put("STRING_LINK-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "fe80:");
527                        prefixes.put("REGEX_TEREDO", "^2001:[0]*:.*$");
528                        prefixes.put("REGEX_BENCHMARKING", "^2001:[0]*2:.*$");
529                        prefixes.put("REGEX_ORCHID", "^2001:[0]*10:.*$");
530                        prefixes.put("STRING_DOCUMENTATION", "2001:db8:");
531                        prefixes.put("STRING_GLOBAL-UNICAST", "2000:");
532                        prefixes.put("REGEX_MULTICAST", "^ff[0-9]{2}:.*$");
533                        final List<Boolean> results = new ArrayList<>();
534                        final String ipLower = ip.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
535                        prefixes.forEach((addressType, expr) -> {
536                            String exprLower = expr.trim().toLowerCase();
537                            if (addressType.startsWith("STRING_")) {
538                                results.add(ipLower.startsWith(exprLower));
539                            } else {
540                                results.add(Pattern.matches(exprLower, ipLower));
541                            }
542                        });
543                        isValid = ((results.size() == prefixes.size()) && !results.contains(Boolean.TRUE));
544                    }
545                }
546            }
547        } catch (Exception e) {
548            isValid = false;
549        }
550        return isValid;
551    }
552
553    /**
554     * Compute a SHA256 hash from an input composed of a collection of strings.<br><br>
555     * This method take care to build the source string in a way to prevent this source string to be prone to abuse targeting the different parts composing it.<br><br>
556     * Example of possible abuse without precautions applied during the hash calculation logic:<br>
557     * Hash of <code>SHA256("Hello", "My", "World!!!")</code> will be equals to the hash of <code>SHA256("Hell", "oMyW", "orld!!!")</code>.<br><br>
558     * This method ensure that both hash above will be different.
559     *
560     * @param parts Ordered list of strings to use to build the input string for which the hash must be computed on. No null value is accepted on object composing the collection.
561     * @return The hash, as an array of bytes, to allow caller to convert it to the final representation wanted (HEX, Base64, etc.). If the collection passed is null or empty then the method return null.
562     * @throws Exception If any exception occurs
563     * @see "https://pentesterlab.com/badges/codereview"
564     */
565    public static byte[] computeHashNoProneToAbuseOnParts(List<String> parts) throws Exception {
566        byte[] hash = null;
567        if (parts != null && !parts.isEmpty()) {
568            //Ensure that not part is null
569            if (parts.stream().anyMatch(Objects::isNull)) {
570                throw new IllegalArgumentException("No part must be null!");
571            }
572            String separator = "|";
573            MessageDigest digest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-256");
574            final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(separator);
575            parts.forEach(p -> {
576                buffer.append(p).append(separator);
577            });
578            hash = digest.digest(buffer.toString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
579        }
580        return hash;
581    }
582
583    /**
584     * Ensure that an XML file only uses DTD/XSD references (called System Identifier) present in the allowed list provided.<br><br>
585     * The code is based on the validation implemented into the OpenJDK 21, by the class <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java">java.util.prefs.XmlSupport</a></b>, in the method <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L240">loadPrefsDoc()</a></b>.<br><br>
586     * The method also ensure that no Public Identifier is used to prevent potential bypasses of the validations.
587     *
588     * @param xmlFilePath              Filename of the XML file to check.
589     * @param allowedSystemIdentifiers List of URL allowed for System Identifier specified for any XSD/DTD references.
590     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
591     * @see "https://www.w3schools.com/xml/prop_documenttype_systemid.asp"
592     * @see "https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/integration-bus/9.0.0?topic=doctypedecl-xml-systemid"
593     * @see "https://www.liquid-technologies.com/Reference/Glossary/XML_DocType.html"
594     * @see "https://www.xml.com/pub/98/08/xmlqna0.html"
595     * @see "https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L397"
596     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formal_Public_Identifier"
597     */
598    public static boolean isXMLOnlyUseAllowedXSDorDTD(String xmlFilePath, final List<String> allowedSystemIdentifiers) {
599        boolean isSafe = false;
600        final String errorTemplate = "Non allowed %s ID detected!";
601        final String emptyFakeDTD = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?><!ELEMENT dummy EMPTY>";
602        final String emptyFakeXSD = "<xs:schema xmlns:xs=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema\"> <xs:element name=\"dummy\"/></xs:schema>";
603
604        if (allowedSystemIdentifiers == null || allowedSystemIdentifiers.isEmpty()) {
605            throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least one SID must be specified!");
606        }
607        File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
608        if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
609            try {
610                EntityResolver resolverValidator = (publicId, systemId) -> {
611                    if (publicId != null) {
612                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "PUBLIC"));
613                    }
614                    if (!allowedSystemIdentifiers.contains(systemId)) {
615                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "SYSTEM"));
616                    }
617                    //If it is OK then return a empty DTD/XSD
618                    return new InputSource(new StringReader(systemId.toLowerCase().endsWith(".dtd") ? emptyFakeDTD : emptyFakeXSD));
619                };
620                DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
621                dbfInstance.setIgnoringElementContentWhitespace(true);
622                dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
623                dbfInstance.setValidating(false);
624                dbfInstance.setCoalescing(true);
625                dbfInstance.setIgnoringComments(false);
626                DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
627                builder.setEntityResolver(resolverValidator);
628                Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
629                isSafe = (doc != null);
630            } catch (SAXException | IOException | ParserConfigurationException e) {
631                isSafe = false;
632            }
633        }
634
635        return isSafe;
636    }
637
638    /**
639     * Apply a collection of validations on a EXCEL CSV file provided (file was expected to be opened in Microsoft EXCEL):<br>
640     * - Real CSV file.<br>
641     * - Do not contains any payload related to a CSV injections.<br><br>
642     * Ensure that, if Apache Commons CSV does not find any record then, the file will be considered as NOT safe (prevent potential bypasses).<br><br>
643     * <b>Note:</b> Record delimiter used is the <code>,</code> (comma) character. See the Apache Commons CSV reference provided for EXCEL.<br>
644     *
645     * @param csvFilePath Filename of the CSV file to check.
646     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
647     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/"
648     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/apidocs/org/apache/commons/csv/CSVFormat.html#EXCEL"
649     * @see "https://www.we45.com/post/your-excel-sheets-are-not-safe-heres-how-to-beat-csv-injection"
650     * @see "https://www.whiteoaksecurity.com/blog/2020-4-23-csv-injection-whats-the-risk/"
651     * @see "https://book.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting-web/formula-csv-doc-latex-ghostscript-injection"
652     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/CSV_Injection"
653     * @see "https://payatu.com/blog/csv-injection-basic-to-exploit/"
654     * @see "https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/1236.html"
655     */
656    public static boolean isExcelCSVSafe(String csvFilePath) {
657        boolean isSafe;
658        final AtomicInteger recordCount = new AtomicInteger();
659        final List<Character> payloadDetectionCharacters = List.of('=', '+', '@', '-', '\r', '\t');
660
661        try {
662            final List<String> payloadsIdentified = new ArrayList<>();
663            try (Reader in = new FileReader(csvFilePath)) {
664                Iterable<CSVRecord> records = CSVFormat.EXCEL.parse(in);
665                records.forEach(record -> {
666                    record.forEach(recordValue -> {
667                        if (recordValue != null && !recordValue.trim().isEmpty() && payloadDetectionCharacters.contains(recordValue.trim().charAt(0))) {
668                            payloadsIdentified.add(recordValue);
669                        }
670                        recordCount.getAndIncrement();
671                    });
672                });
673            }
674            isSafe = (payloadsIdentified.isEmpty() && recordCount.get() > 0);
675        } catch (Exception e) {
676            isSafe = false;
677        }
678
679        return isSafe;
680    }
681
682    /**
683     * Provide a way to add an integrity marker (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC">HMAC</a>) to a serialized object serialized using the <a href="https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization">java native system</a> (binary).<br>
684     * The goal is to provide <b>a temporary workaround</b> to try to prevent deserialization attacks and give time to move to a text-based serialization approach.
685     *
686     * @param processingMode Define the mode of processing i.e. protect or validate. ({@link eu.righettod.ProcessingMode})
687     * @param input          When the processing mode is "protect" than the expected input (string) is a java serialized object encoded in Base64 otherwise (processing mode is "validate") expected input is the output of this method when the "protect" mode was used.
688     * @param secret         Secret to use to compute the SHA256 HMAC.
689     * @return A map with the following keys: <ul><li><b>PROCESSING_MODE</b>: Processing mode used to compute the result.</li><li><b>STATUS</b>: A boolean indicating if the processing was successful or not.</li><li><b>RESULT</b>: Always contains a string representing the protected serialized object in the format <code>[SERIALIZED_OBJECT_BASE64_ENCODED]:[SERIALIZED_OBJECT_HMAC_BASE64_ENCODED]</code>.</li></ul>
690     * @throws Exception If any exception occurs.
691     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Deserialization_Cheat_Sheet.html"
692     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/2017/A8_2017-Insecure_Deserialization"
693     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/deserialization"
694     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization-approaches"
695     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization"
696     * @see "https://cryptobook.nakov.com/mac-and-key-derivation/hmac-and-key-derivation"
697     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC"
698     * @see "https://smattme.com/posts/how-to-generate-hmac-signature-in-java/"
699     */
700    public static Map<String, Object> ensureSerializedObjectIntegrity(ProcessingMode processingMode, String input, byte[] secret) throws Exception {
701        Map<String, Object> results;
702        String resultFormatTemplate = "%s:%s";
703        //Verify input provided to be consistent
704        if (processingMode == null) {
705            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The processing mode is mandatory!");
706        }
707        if (input == null || input.trim().isEmpty()) {
708            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input data is mandatory!");
709        }
710        if (secret == null || secret.length == 0) {
711            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The HMAC secret is mandatory!");
712        }
713        if (processingMode.equals(ProcessingMode.VALIDATE) && input.split(":").length != 2) {
714            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input data provided is invalid for the processing mode specified!");
715        }
716        //Processing
717        Base64.Decoder b64Decoder = Base64.getDecoder();
718        Base64.Encoder b64Encoder = Base64.getEncoder();
719        String hmacAlgorithm = "HmacSHA256";
720        Mac mac = Mac.getInstance(hmacAlgorithm);
721        SecretKeySpec key = new SecretKeySpec(secret, hmacAlgorithm);
722        mac.init(key);
723        results = new HashMap<>();
724        results.put("PROCESSING_MODE", processingMode.toString());
725        switch (processingMode) {
726            case PROTECT -> {
727                byte[] objectBytes = b64Decoder.decode(input);
728                byte[] hmac = mac.doFinal(objectBytes);
729                String encodedHmac = b64Encoder.encodeToString(hmac);
730                results.put("STATUS", Boolean.TRUE);
731                results.put("RESULT", String.format(resultFormatTemplate, input, encodedHmac));
732            }
733            case VALIDATE -> {
734                String[] parts = input.split(":");
735                byte[] objectBytes = b64Decoder.decode(parts[0].trim());
736                byte[] hmacProvided = b64Decoder.decode(parts[1].trim());
737                byte[] hmacComputed = mac.doFinal(objectBytes);
738                String encodedHmacComputed = b64Encoder.encodeToString(hmacComputed);
739                Boolean hmacIsValid = Arrays.equals(hmacProvided, hmacComputed);
740                results.put("STATUS", hmacIsValid);
741                results.put("RESULT", String.format(resultFormatTemplate, parts[0].trim(), encodedHmacComputed));
742            }
743            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Not supported processing mode!");
744        }
745        return results;
746    }
747
748    /**
749     * Apply a collection of validations on a JSON string provided:<br>
750     * - Real JSON structure.<br>
751     * - Contain less than a specified number of deepness for nested objects or arrays.<br>
752     * - Contain less than a specified number of items in any arrays.<br><br>
753     *
754     * <b>Note:</b> I decided to use a parsing approach using only string processing to prevent any StackOverFlow or OutOfMemory error that can be abused.<br><br>
755     * I used the following assumption:
756     * <ul>
757     *      <li>The character <code>{</code> identify the beginning of an object.</li>
758     *      <li>The character <code>}</code> identify the end of an object.</li>
759     *      <li>The character <code>[</code> identify the beginning of an array.</li>
760     *      <li>The character <code>]</code> identify the end of an array.</li>
761     *      <li>The character <code>"</code> identify the delimiter of a string.</li>
762     *      <li>The character sequence <code>\"</code> identify the escaping of an double quote.</li>
763     * </ul>
764     *
765     * @param json                  String containing the JSON data to validate.
766     * @param maxItemsByArraysCount Maximum number of items allowed in an array.
767     * @param maxDeepnessAllowed    Maximum number nested objects or arrays allowed.
768     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
769     * @see "https://javaee.github.io/jsonp/"
770     * @see "https://community.f5.com/discussions/technicalforum/disable-buffer-overflow-in-json-parameters/124306"
771     * @see "https://github.com/InductiveComputerScience/pbJson/issues/2"
772     */
773    public static boolean isJSONSafe(String json, int maxItemsByArraysCount, int maxDeepnessAllowed) {
774        boolean isSafe = false;
775
776        try {
777            //Step 1: Analyse the JSON string
778            int currentDeepness = 0;
779            int currentArrayItemsCount = 0;
780            int maxDeepnessReached = 0;
781            int maxArrayItemsCountReached = 0;
782            boolean currentlyInArray = false;
783            boolean currentlyInString = false;
784            int currentNestedArrayLevel = 0;
785            String jsonEscapedDoubleQuote = "\\\"";//Escaped double quote must not be considered as a string delimiter
786            String work = json.replace(jsonEscapedDoubleQuote, "'");
787            for (char c : work.toCharArray()) {
788                switch (c) {
789                    case '{': {
790                        if (!currentlyInString) {
791                            currentDeepness++;
792                        }
793                        break;
794                    }
795                    case '}': {
796                        if (!currentlyInString) {
797                            currentDeepness--;
798                        }
799                        break;
800                    }
801                    case '[': {
802                        if (!currentlyInString) {
803                            currentDeepness++;
804                            if (currentlyInArray) {
805                                currentNestedArrayLevel++;
806                            }
807                            currentlyInArray = true;
808                        }
809                        break;
810                    }
811                    case ']': {
812                        if (!currentlyInString) {
813                            currentDeepness--;
814                            currentArrayItemsCount = 0;
815                            if (currentNestedArrayLevel > 0) {
816                                currentNestedArrayLevel--;
817                            }
818                            if (currentNestedArrayLevel == 0) {
819                                currentlyInArray = false;
820                            }
821                        }
822                        break;
823                    }
824                    case '"': {
825                        currentlyInString = !currentlyInString;
826                        break;
827                    }
828                    case ',': {
829                        if (!currentlyInString && currentlyInArray) {
830                            currentArrayItemsCount++;
831                        }
832                        break;
833                    }
834                }
835                if (currentDeepness > maxDeepnessReached) {
836                    maxDeepnessReached = currentDeepness;
837                }
838                if (currentArrayItemsCount > maxArrayItemsCountReached) {
839                    maxArrayItemsCountReached = currentArrayItemsCount;
840                }
841            }
842            //Step 2: Apply validation against the value specified as limits
843            isSafe = ((maxItemsByArraysCount > maxArrayItemsCountReached) && (maxDeepnessAllowed > maxDeepnessReached));
844
845            //Step 3: If the content is safe then ensure that it is valid JSON structure using the "Java API for JSON Processing" (JSR 374) parser reference implementation.
846            if (isSafe) {
847                JsonReader reader = Json.createReader(new StringReader(json));
848                isSafe = (reader.read() != null);
849            }
850
851        } catch (Exception e) {
852            isSafe = false;
853        }
854        return isSafe;
855    }
856
857    /**
858     * Apply a collection of validations on a image file provided:<br>
859     * - Real image file.<br>
860     * - Its mime type is into the list of allowed mime types.<br>
861     * - Its metadata fields do not contains any characters related to a malicious payloads.<br>
862     *
863     * <br>
864     * <b>Important note:</b> This implementation is prone to bypass using the "<b>raw insertion</b>" method documented in the <a href="https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there">blog post</a> from the Synacktiv team.
865     * To handle such case, it is recommended to resize the image to remove any non image-related content, see <a href="https://github.com/righettod/document-upload-protection/blob/master/src/main/java/eu/righettod/poc/sanitizer/ImageDocumentSanitizerImpl.java#L54">here</a> for an example.<br>
866     *
867     * @param imageFilePath         Filename of the image file to check.
868     * @param imageAllowedMimeTypes List of image mime types allowed.
869     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
870     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-imaging/"
871     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-imaging/formatsupport.html"
872     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types/Common_types"
873     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#image"
874     * @see "https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there"
875     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/File_Upload_Cheat_Sheet.html"
876     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/document-upload-protection/blob/master/src/main/java/eu/righettod/poc/sanitizer/ImageDocumentSanitizerImpl.java"
877     * @see "https://exiftool.org/examples.html"
878     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_file_signatures"
879     * @see "https://hexed.it/"
880     * @see "https://github.com/sighook/pixload"
881     */
882    public static boolean isImageSafe(String imageFilePath, List<String> imageAllowedMimeTypes) {
883        boolean isSafe = false;
884        Pattern payloadDetectionRegex = Pattern.compile("[<>${}`]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
885        try {
886            File imgFile = new File(imageFilePath);
887            if (imgFile.exists() && imgFile.canRead() && imgFile.isFile() && !imageAllowedMimeTypes.isEmpty()) {
888                final byte[] imgBytes = Files.readAllBytes(imgFile.toPath());
889                //Step 1: Check the mime type of the file against the allowed ones
890                ImageInfo imgInfo = Imaging.getImageInfo(imgBytes);
891                if (imageAllowedMimeTypes.contains(imgInfo.getMimeType())) {
892                    //Step 2: Load the image into an object using the Image API
893                    BufferedImage imgObject = Imaging.getBufferedImage(imgBytes);
894                    if (imgObject != null && imgObject.getWidth() > 0 && imgObject.getHeight() > 0) {
895                        //Step 3: Check the metadata if the image format support it - Highly experimental
896                        List<String> metadataWithPayloads = new ArrayList<>();
897                        final ImageMetadata imgMetadata = Imaging.getMetadata(imgBytes);
898                        if (imgMetadata != null) {
899                            imgMetadata.getItems().forEach(item -> {
900                                String metadata = item.toString();
901                                if (payloadDetectionRegex.matcher(metadata).find()) {
902                                    metadataWithPayloads.add(metadata);
903                                }
904                            });
905                        }
906                        isSafe = metadataWithPayloads.isEmpty();
907                    }
908                }
909            }
910        } catch (Exception e) {
911            isSafe = false;
912        }
913        return isSafe;
914    }
915}
